SourceText: Here is a comic on praising your teen.

SourceText: Parent: “Thank you for being quiet while I talked to my boss. I appreciate it! Here, you can use my phone to WhatsApp your friends”
text: Parent: “Thank you for being quiet while I talked to my boss. I appreciate it! Here, you can use my phone to WhatsApp your friends”

SourceText: Parent: “Thank you for playing quietly while I was doing work. In 5 minutes I will be able to join you.”
text: Parent: “Thank you for playing quietly while I was doing work. In 5 minutes I will be able to join you.”

SourceText: Parent: “I really appreciate you playing quietly together while I worked. Now I can play with you for a bit. What would you like to do?”
text: Parent: “I really appreciate you playing quietly together while I worked. Now I can play with you for a bit. What would you like to do?”

SourceText: Parent 1: “Good job, Jessie! You are reading very well!”
text: Parent 1: “Good job, Jessie! You are reading very well!”

SourceText: Parent 2: “The weather today is so nice. It is a shame I have not had time to go outside for a walk.”
text: Parent 2: “The weather today is so nice. It is a shame I have not had time to go outside for a walk.”

SourceText: Parent 1: “If you would like to get some fresh air and exercise, my dear, I can continue helping the children with their homework while you go for your afternoon walk.”
text: Parent 1: “If you would like to get some fresh air and exercise, my dear, I can continue helping the children with their homework while you go for your afternoon walk.”

SourceText: Parent 2: “That would be wonderful, my love! Thank you for being so supportive.”
text: Parent 2: “That would be wonderful, my love! Thank you for being so supportive.”

SourceText: Parent 1: “Of course! It is fun to help the children with their reading practice! They are doing so well.”
text: Parent 1: “Of course! It is fun to help the children with their reading practice! They are doing so well.”
